text: <@ULDAVFDRP> not really. i prefer something that i can see incremental gains/rewards with, rather than working for years *hoping* i get something out of it. like $10 a day might sound nothing but it is more to me than a dollar figure. it's a measure of progress and indication that i'm on the right track. whereas if I have money flowing to me easily from other sources it might just be an indication that i'm meant to do that other thing, rather that continually butting my head up against the wall.

text: fair enough mate, sounds like your describing a normal day job to be honest. Very few investments operate like that, maybe interest on a very large amount in a bank is the one that I can think of. I can guarantee to you now that gambling will never fall into the stable income category and as stakes rise it just gets even more volatile. If you have better opportunities run with those, I mean gambling isn't really anything special. Its not exactly like we are contributing to the world or doing any good.

text: <@ULDAVFDRP> thanks mate i appreciate the feedback. i'm not pessimistic about what it's possible to earn, i'm just frustrated that i can't crack it. i don't know if i'm learning the right things. and as for doing the world any good, how do you know? your trading supports Betfair, which helps hundreds (thousands?) of people put food on their table. And gives joy to people who like to gamble at the best possible prices.

text: There are over 1000 people on here and I presume most of them can do a bit of coding plus a bit more but how many do you think "have cracked it" and I do believe there is a random element as well in finding that right path. If it was really easy no-one here would be in profit and looking back as income streams go, this really isn't the best path for all.
